properties.areaDesc: Dickinson, IA; Cottonwood, MN; Jackson, MN
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 4:55PM CDT until May 30 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls SD
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
North central Dickinson County in northwestern Iowa...
Eastern Jackson County in southwestern Minnesota...
Southeastern Cottonwood County in southwestern Minnesota...

* Until 530 PM CDT.

* At 454 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Orleans, or
near Spirit Lake, moving northeast at 75 mph.

HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail
damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect
wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* This severe thunderstorm will be near...
Jackson In Jackson County around 505 PM CDT.
Kilen Woods State Park around 510 PM CDT.

Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include
Bergen, Mountain Lake and Comfrey.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for northwestern
Iowa...and southwestern Minnesota.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for northwestern
Iowa...and southwestern Minnesota.

properties.areaDesc: Walton, GA
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 5:55PM EDT until May 30 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Central Walton County in north central Georgia...

* Until 630 PM EDT.

* At 555 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Herndonville,
or 7 miles south of Monroe, moving northwest at 10 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage
to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Monroe, Social Circle, Jersey, Herndonville, Ebenezer and Pannell.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

If you see wind damage...hail or flooding...wait until the storm has
passed...and then call the National Weather Service toll free
at 1 8 6 6 7 6 3 4 4 6 6 or tweet us your report at NWSATLANTA.

properties.areaDesc: Douglas, MN; Pope, MN
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 4:53PM CDT until May 30 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
The storm which prompted the warning has moved out of the area.
Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.

A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and
west central Minnesota.

To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service
the Twin Cities.

Remember, a Tornado Warning still remains in effect for eastern Pope
County until 530 PM.

NWSheadline: THE TORNADO WARNING FOR EASTERN DOUGLAS AND EASTERN POPE COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 500 PM CDT

properties.areaDesc: Cottonwood, MN; Jackson, MN
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 4:52PM CDT until May 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls SD
properties.description:
At 451 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located near Heron Lake, or 7 miles west of Windom, moving north
at 60 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This dangerous storm will be near...
Wilder, Storden and Bingham Lake around 500 PM CDT.

Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include
Jeffers.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL JACKSON AND CENTRAL COTTONWOOD COUNTIES

properties.areaDesc: Suwannee
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
properties.description:
At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near
Mcalpin, or 9 miles northeast of Mayo, moving southeast at 10 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and minor
flooding due to heavy rainfall.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is
possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible.

Locations impacted include...
Dowling Park, Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville and Newburn.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

NWSheadline: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Suwannee County through 615 PM EDT

possible.

Lake Park, Valdosta, I-75 At Exit 16, Dasher, I-75 At Exit 5, Twin

properties.instruction:
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

NWSheadline: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Madison, southwestern Lowndes and southeastern Brooks Counties through 630 PM EDT

properties.areaDesc: Kandiyohi, MN; Pope, MN; Stearns, MN; Swift, MN
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 4:50PM CDT until May 30 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
At 450 PM CDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both
tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located near
Murdock, or 19 miles northwest of Willmar, moving northeast at 85
mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is
likely.

Locations impacted include...
Sauk Centre, Kerkhoven, Brooten, Murdock, Grove Lake, Villard,
Gilchrist, De Graff, Sunburg, Westport, Sedan and Swift Falls.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and
widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the
tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest
floor of a building.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR EASTERN POPE...NORTHWESTERN STEARNS...EASTERN SWIFT AND NORTHWESTERN KANDIYOHI COUNTIES

properties.areaDesc: Otter Tail, MN
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 4:47PM CDT until May 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Grand Forks ND
properties.description:
At 447 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located near Henning, or 30 miles east of Fergus Falls, moving
north at 70 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

Locations impacted include...
Henning, Ottertail, Deer Creek, Clitherall, Vining, Almora and
eastern Ottertail Lake.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

If on or near any lake, get away from the water and move to safe
shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough
to be struck by lightning. Severe thunderstorms can produce large
capsizing waves, even on small bodies of water. Move into dock and
seek safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a
thunderstorm.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OTTER TAIL COUNTY

properties.areaDesc: Redwood, MN; Renville, MN; Yellow Medicine, MN
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 4:47PM CDT until May 30 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
At 447 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 5 miles southeast of Granite Falls to Echo to 9 miles
west of Wabasso, moving northeast at 70 mph.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile
homes, roofs, and outbuildings.

Locations impacted include...
Renville, Walnut Grove, Wabasso, Sacred Heart, Wood Lake, Echo,
Minnesota Falls, Belview, Vesta, Milroy, Lucan and Revere.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central,
southwestern and west central Minnesota.

Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread
significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately
likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of
a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant
property damage.

NWSheadline: A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR WESTERN REDWOOD...SOUTHEASTERN YELLOW MEDICINE AND NORTHWESTERN RENVILLE COUNTIES

properties.areaDesc: Douglas, MN; Todd, MN
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 4:45PM CDT until May 30 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Eastern Douglas County in west central Minnesota...
Todd County in central Minnesota...

* Until 530 PM CDT.

* At 445 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado
was located along a line extending from near Carlos to 9 miles
south of Lake Osakis, moving northeast at 60 mph.

This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW!

HAZARD...Damaging tornado.

SOURCE...Emergency management confirmed tornado.

IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris
may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile
homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes,
businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete
destruction is possible.

* These tornadic storms will be near...
Lake Osakis around 455 PM CDT.
Long Prairie and Eagle Bend around 505 PM CDT.
Browerville and Bertha around 510 PM CDT.
Clarissa and Hewitt around 515 PM CDT.

Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Rose City,
Belle River, Round Prairie, Little Sauk, West Union and Clotho.
properties.instruction:
Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the
tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

CMAMtext: NWS: TORNADO WARNING in this area til 5:30 PM CDT. Take shelter now. Check media.
CMAMlongtext: National Weather Service: TORNADO WARNING in this area until 5:30 PM CDT. Take shelter now in a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Check media.

Monticello, Alma, Fincher, Festus, Lamont, Aucilla, Baum, Capps,

Casa Blanco, Jarrott, Waukeenah, Montivilla and Wacissa.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

NWSheadline: Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jefferson and northeastern Leon Counties through 600 PM EDT

properties.areaDesc: Coastal Lee; Inland Lee
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
properties.description:
At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near Cape Coral to near Iona to near Bonita
Springs. These storms were nearly stationary.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is
possible.

Locations impacted include...
Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Bonita Springs, Matlacha, Palmona Park,
Harlem Heights, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, Iona, Cypress Lake, Pine
Island Center, McGregor, Pine Manor, Lovers Key State Park, Matlacha
Isles-Matlacha Shores, Pineland, St. James City, Villas, Saint James
City, Punta Rassa and Fort Myers Villas.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

NWSheadline: Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lee County through 600 PM EDT

properties.areaDesc: Buchanan; Delaware; Dubuque; Benton; Linn; Jones; Jackson; Iowa; Johnson; Cedar; Clinton; Muscatine; Scott; Jo Daviess; Stephenson; Carroll; Whiteside; Rock Island; Henry; Bureau; Putnam
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:19PM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
Windy conditions will continue through 8 PM, with south winds
sustained between 20 to 30 mph and gusting upwards to 40 to 45
mph.

Loose objects may be blown around and the strongest gusts could
bring down small tree limbs. If driving, be sure to keep a firm
grip on the wheel, especially on west to east roads and in high
profile vehicles

NWSheadline: Strong Winds Through This Evening

properties.areaDesc: Humboldt County; Northern Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; White Pine County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; South Central Elko County; Northwestern Nye County; Northeastern Nye County
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 1:16PM PDT by NWS Elko NV
properties.description:
Overnight temps will be cold over the next two nights, leading to
frost and freeze conditions. Expect low temperatures in the upper 20s
to lower 30s in the colder valleys Monday night. On Tuesday night,
low temperatures will generally be in the 30s in the colder valleys.

Anyone with sensitive outside plants, crops, pets and livestock should
take appropriate preventative measures.

Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.

NWSheadline: Frost and Freeze conditions expected Monday and Tuesday night

properties.areaDesc: Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Glacier Bay; Eastern Chichagof Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 12:05PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
properties.description:
Conditions remain dry across Southeast Alaska and temperatures
will rise to the upper 70s across much of the region over the
next few days. Fine fuels are dry and there is a risk of camp
fires getting out of control. Winds will remain light, which is a
mitigating circumstance working in our favor.

All individuals are encouraged to be mindful of the dry and warm
conditions during the remainder of this holiday weekend and into
the next week.

NWSheadline: INCREASED FIRE DANGER THIS COMING WEEK

properties.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
Strong west to northwest wind gusts 50 to 55 MPH likely through
the afternoon in portions of southeast Wyoming. Main timing is
between now and 6 PM MDT. Maintain caution if traveling with
light, high profile vehicles.

properties.areaDesc: Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Southern Hidalgo; Inland Willacy; Inland Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Northern Hidalgo; Coastal Willacy; Coastal Cameron
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 11:56AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
properties.description:
Observations indicate strong south-southeasterly winds across
Kenedy, Willacy, Cameron, Hidalgo and Brooks counties. Locations
in these counties can expect sustained wind speeds of 20 to 30 mph
with gusts between 35 and 40 mph this afternoon into early this
evening.

Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle in cross winds, and secure outdoor objects.

NWSheadline: GUSTY SOUTH-SOUTHEAST WINDS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE COASTAL COUNTIES, ALONG WITH HIDALGO AND BROOKS COUNTY

properties.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook/Northern Lake
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 7:47AM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
properties.description:
Thunderstorms will affect the Boundary Waters Canoe Area
Wilderness today into tonight. General thunderstorms are possible
periodically throughout the day, with stronger thunderstorms
expected this evening into tonight. The storms will be capable of
erratic and gusty winds of 70 mph, hail up to two inches in size,
an isolated tornado or two, frequent cloud-to- ground lightning,
and locally heavy rainfall, which may lead to localized flooding
of creeks, streams, and low- lying areas.

Campers should take extra precautions in order to secure
campsites and make a plan in case of severe weather. Check
campsites for possible hazards, including standing dead trees or
limbs, as well as low spots where water can pool. Move tents away
from creeks and rivers in case of flash flooding. Prepare to
protect yourself from large hail using sleeping bags or other
padded items. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for updates and possible
warnings.

NWSheadline: STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS MONDAY EVENING AND MONDAY NIGHT

properties.areaDesc: La Salle; McMullen; Live Oak; Webb; Duval; Jim Wells; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:39AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
properties.description:
The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will
produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees this afternoon
from the southern portions of the inland Coastal Bend to the Brush
Country and Rio Grande Plains. Residents with outdoor activities
planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and
light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.
Young children and pets should never be left unattended in
vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during
warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal
temperatures in a matter of minutes.

NWSheadline: HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Northern St. Lawrence; Northern Franklin; Eastern Clinton; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex; Eastern Essex; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Grand Isle; Western Franklin; Orleans; Essex; Western Chittenden; Lamoille; Caledonia; Washington; Western Addison; Orange; Western Rutland; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Western Windsor; Eastern Windsor
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
...Please check with state and local authorities regarding
guidelines for allowed activities...

* The warm air temperatures today, highs in the upper 70s to mid 80s,
may cause people to underestimate the dangers of the cold water
temperatures which are currently only in the lower 50s across Lake
Champlain, and in the upper 50s in the region's smaller lakes and
rivers.

* The cold water temperatures can quickly cause hypothermia to
anyone immersed in the water. When the water temperature is below
60 degrees, the average submerged person could lose dexterity
within minutes and be unable to accomplish simple tasks. Anyone
on small boats, canoes or kayaks should plan accordingly if
recreating this weekend and use extreme caution to avoid this
threat. Paddle smart from the start and always wear your life
jacket!

* Strong winds are also expected this weekend with gusts up to 23
mph from the southwest. If boating on large bodies of water,
these strong winds can increase the likelihood of overturning
your boat,canoe or kayak due to increased wave heights.

NWSheadline: National Weather Service Cold Water Safety Message
